Detailed Description

A layout that associates with fragments.

User can swipes left and right to switch fragments.

 TabPageController* pController = new TabPageController(this);

 Fragment* pFgX = new FragmentX();
 Fragment* pFgY = new FragmentY();
 pController->addFragment(String("FragmentX"), pFgX);
 pController->addFragment(String("FragmentY"), pFgY);

 IPageChangeListener* pPageChangeListener = new MyPageChangeListener(this);
 pController->setOnPageChangeListener(pPageChangeListener);
 pController->setCurrentItem(0);

Definition at line 47 of file TabPageController.h.

int32_t gaia::ui::TabPageController::getOffscreenPageLimit ( )

Returns the number of pages that will be retained to either side of the current page in the view hierarchy in an idle state.

Defaults to 1.

Returns:
How many pages will be kept offscreen on either side

void gaia::ui::TabPageController::setOffscreenPageLimit ( int32_t  limit)

Set the number of pages that should be retained to either side of the current page in the view hierarchy in an idle state.

Pages beyond this limit will be recreated from the adapter when needed.

This is offered as an optimization. If you know in advance the number of pages you will need to support or have lazy-loading mechanisms in place on your pages, tweaking this setting can have benefits in perceived smoothness of paging animations and interaction. If you have a small number of pages (3-4) that you can keep active all at once, less time will be spent in layout for newly created view subtrees as the user pages back and forth.

Parameters:
limitHow many pages will be kept offscreen in an idle state.
void gaia::ui::TabPageController::setOnPageChangeListener ( gaia::ui::IPageChangeListener *  listener)
